Class ServerReceive

  • java.lang.Object
    • ServerReceive

  • public class ServerReceive
extends java.lang.Object
    ServerReceive contains methods that receives messages from the client, and processes them appropriately.

    Receives packets from client correspond to user operations including:

    • Delete Account
    • Send Message
    • Check Inbox
    • List Users
    • End Session

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ServerReceive()

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServerReceive

        public ServerReceive()

    • Method Detail

      • createAccount

        public static void createAccount(java.net.Socket conn,
                                 byte[] data,
                                 ClientHandler handle)
        Handles request to create an account. Account creation fails if username is not at least one character or if account already exists under that username. If successful, account will be created on the server end. Sends a packet notifying the client on success or failure.

      • login

        public static void login(java.net.Socket conn,
                         byte[] data,
                         ClientHandler handle)
        Handles request to log in. Log in fails if account does not exist, or if the account is already logged in. If successful, user will be logged in on the client side. Sends a packet notifying the client on success or failure.

      • listAllAccounts

        public static void listAllAccounts(java.net.Socket conn,
                                   byte[] data)
        Handles request to list account names. Listing account name should not usually fail; if no account names pattern match to the Java regular expression inputted by the user, then simply indicate that no usernames match. Sends a packet containing the queried list, and notifies the client on success or failure.

      • pullAllMessages

        public static void pullAllMessages(java.net.Socket conn,
                                   byte[] data)
        Handles request to pull all messages, or check inbox. Checking inbox should not usually fail; if a user has no messages, the client will see a message indicating there are no messages. Sends a packet containing all user messages, and notifies the client on success or failure.

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage(java.net.Socket conn,
                               byte[] data)
        Handles request to send message. Send message fails if recipient username does not exist. If successful, message will be successfully sent from sender to recipient. Sends a packet notifying the sender on success or failure.

      • deleteAccount

        public static void deleteAccount(java.net.Socket conn,
                                 byte[] data)
        Handles request to delete account. Delete account fails if user has unread messages and fails to confirm deletion. If successful, account will be deleted and the client session will end. Sends a packet notifying the client on success or failure.

      • endSession

        public static void endSession(java.net.Socket conn,
                              byte[] data)
        Handles request to end session. Closes the socket. Sends a packet notifying the client on success or failure.
